newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks close slightly down on rates, merger.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks close slightly down on rates, merger.

text.p: Worries about high Thai interest rates and delayed merger of Thai Danu Bank and Finance One helped the stock market to close marginally lower, brokers said on Friday.

"Investors sold to take profits due to uncertainty of the Thai Danu -Finance One talks. They also waited to see whether local banks would cut interest rates," said Busaba Kunasirin of Chao Phya Finance and Securities.
The composite SET index closed 0.26 point lower at 581.13 on sluggish 3.2 billion baht turnover.
Both Thai Danu Bank and Finance One, Thailand's largest finance company, were scheduled to announce progress of their alliance talks later on Friday.
But a senior Thai Danu official said shortly before the market close that his bank and Finance One had agreed to scrap their March agreement on negotiating a merger.
Brokers said investors were reluctant to invest as they waited for Thai interest rate cuts.
Most key sectors, except the banking counter, retreated. Banks gained 1.38 percent and the communications sector dropped 1.11 percent.
Krung Thai Bank topped the active list, rising 0.25 baht to 30.25, TelecomAsia fell one to 30.75, and Nava Finance dropped 1.25 to 15.25.
